body: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.
body_html: Mods are still stuck on 1.7.10 anyway because the code just got so bloated after that. They made all sorts of changes that don't do anything but make it harder to run, like having a whole class for every single position instead of just 3 simple ints. And it also broke mods, so that's why a lot haven't updated.

parent.body: Cubic completely nukes compatibility with like 99% of mods though so if they just yoinked Cubic and integrated it into the game mods would be dead for a good while, and they don't really want to kill off mods which is actually why don't have an official modding API.
parent.body_html: Cubic completely nukes compatibility with like 99% of mods though so if they just yoinked Cubic and integrated it into the game mods would be dead for a good while, and they don't really want to kill off mods which is actually why don't have an official modding API.

body: Creative mode and the new blocks, probably the endermen, more biomes (but with the old generator), new ores and gems and maybe the dragon, but no end and it shouldn't be hostile or destroy blocks. Possibly villages but with no trades. Definitely not hunger or any of the overhauled mechanics. Horses probably. Nothing like mineshafts or temples or anything like that, definitely not woodland mansions. Basically keep it the same simple building game. Nothing that mods the vanilla experience, just some new additions. The new textures are too consistent and mess with its charm too.
body_html: Creative mode and the new blocks, probably the endermen, more biomes (but with the old generator), new ores and gems and maybe the dragon, but no end and it shouldn't be hostile or destroy blocks. Possibly villages but with no trades. Definitely not hunger or any of the overhauled mechanics. Horses probably. Nothing like mineshafts or temples or anything like that, definitely not woodland mansions. Basically keep it the same simple building game. Nothing that mods the vanilla experience, just some new additions. The new textures are too consistent and mess with its charm too.

body:
> I asked you if he was the son of God, you replied he was the son of Mary, denying both the incarnation and sonship

I never said such a thing. I said by your logic of "son" you should consider it so.

> and God is called ha/ton theos.

It depends on the noun case and the writing style. Articles are sometimes used with titles and names, but other times they are not.

> And no, satanist, it's not referring to another God, since there's only one God

You just said it's not referring to God but then you say it can't be referring to anything else. Which is it?

> And look, you didn't answer or adress John 17:3, like I already knew you wouldn't. Did you think I would miss that part because of your verbosity and sophistry? This is also something you pathologically lying pagans pathologically do. Adress John 17:3, polytheist.

What exactly do you want me to address about it?

> No, satanist, this is another Clownian lie. Are you suggesting God would chastize people over observing the Torah they were commanded to serve with all their souls, hearts and minds *too well*?

Of course not, but they got it completely wrong by following it by letter instead of spirit. In fact they even falsely accused Jesus of having broken it because of this interpretation. They used it to proclaim their own self-righteousness and control others by making them follow made-up rules that they couldn't even keep themselves.

> Nothing was done for you, polytheist. Idolaters wasn't promised salvation, and you don't even follow the most important commandment.

Okay this is just a straight up lie. First of all, idolators worship other gods, which I do not. And technically no, I haven't kept the most important commandment because no one besides Jesus in all of history has ever been able to do so. However I do follow it as best I can. But I should warn you that your pride and superior attitude right now is a direct violation of that very same commandment.

I asked you if he was the son of God, you replied he was the son of Mary, denying both the incarnation and sonship

I never said such a thing. I said by your logic of "son" you should consider it so.

and God is called ha/ton theos.

It depends on the noun case and the writing style. Articles are sometimes used with titles and names, but other times they are not.

And no, satanist, it's not referring to another God, since there's only one God

You just said it's not referring to God but then you say it can't be referring to anything else. Which is it?

And look, you didn't answer or adress John 17:3, like I already knew you wouldn't. Did you think I would miss that part because of your verbosity and sophistry? This is also something you pathologically lying pagans pathologically do. Adress John 17:3, polytheist.

What exactly do you want me to address about it?

No, satanist, this is another Clownian lie. Are you suggesting God would chastize people over observing the Torah they were commanded to serve with all their souls, hearts and minds too well?

Of course not, but they got it completely wrong by following it by letter instead of spirit. In fact they even falsely accused Jesus of having broken it because of this interpretation. They used it to proclaim their own self-righteousness and control others by making them follow made-up rules that they couldn't even keep themselves.

Nothing was done for you, polytheist. Idolaters wasn't promised salvation, and you don't even follow the most important commandment.

Okay this is just a straight up lie. First of all, idolators worship other gods, which I do not. And technically no, I haven't kept the most important commandment because no one besides Jesus in all of history has ever been able to do so. However I do follow it as best I can. But I should warn you that your pride and superior attitude right now is a direct violation of that very same commandment.

parent.body:
>When did I ever do that? I was just pointing out how it would go by your logic.

You pagans can't stop lying, it's really a demonic sickness. I asked you if he was the son of God, you replied he was the son of Mary, denying both the incarnation and sonship. Which is it then polytheist, you're all over the place?

>Actually, yes I can. Articles aren't strictly necessary in the Greek language, 

I know it's not, satanists, hence the logos is called theos, and God is called ha/ton theos. So answer why. And no, satanist, it's not referring to another God, since there's only one God, and Jesus is not God. That's what you satanist believe. You're just projecting now.

And look, you didn't answer or adress John 17:3, like I already knew you wouldn't. Did you think I would miss that part because of your verbosity and sophistry? This is also something you pathologically lying pagans pathologically do. Adress John 17:3, polytheist. 

>Yes I do, they were the type who interpret everything literally and use it to proclaim their self righteousness and control others with made up rules that they can't even follow themselves. They talk about the speck in their brother's eye but have a log in their own eye.

No, satanist, this is another Clownian lie. Are you suggesting God would chastize people over observing the Torah they were commanded to serve with all their souls, hearts and minds *too well*? Every lie you pagans fabricate is just so utterly ridicolous in it's satanic delusion. They are the ancestors of Rabbinical/Orthodox Judaism. And they are still infinitely better than you idol worshippers. 

>They don't have the son, 

Lmao. What son? You just denied the sonship. Which is it, polytheist, is he God's son or God #2? How many times do I need to ask you the same questions?

>we were given the two/one commandments to do for now, and we know what was done for us.

Nothing was done for you, polytheist. Idolaters wasn't promised salvation, and you don't even follow the most important commandment.
parent.body_html:
When did I ever do that? I was just pointing out how it would go by your logic.

You pagans can't stop lying, it's really a demonic sickness. I asked you if he was the son of God, you replied he was the son of Mary, denying both the incarnation and sonship. Which is it then polytheist, you're all over the place?

Actually, yes I can. Articles aren't strictly necessary in the Greek language,

I know it's not, satanists, hence the logos is called theos, and God is called ha/ton theos. So answer why. And no, satanist, it's not referring to another God, since there's only one God, and Jesus is not God. That's what you satanist believe. You're just projecting now.

And look, you didn't answer or adress John 17:3, like I already knew you wouldn't. Did you think I would miss that part because of your verbosity and sophistry? This is also something you pathologically lying pagans pathologically do. Adress John 17:3, polytheist.

Yes I do, they were the type who interpret everything literally and use it to proclaim their self righteousness and control others with made up rules that they can't even follow themselves. They talk about the speck in their brother's eye but have a log in their own eye.

No, satanist, this is another Clownian lie. Are you suggesting God would chastize people over observing the Torah they were commanded to serve with all their souls, hearts and minds too well? Every lie you pagans fabricate is just so utterly ridicolous in it's satanic delusion. They are the ancestors of Rabbinical/Orthodox Judaism. And they are still infinitely better than you idol worshippers.

They don't have the son,

Lmao. What son? You just denied the sonship. Which is it, polytheist, is he God's son or God #2? How many times do I need to ask you the same questions?

we were given the two/one commandments to do for now, and we know what was done for us.

Nothing was done for you, polytheist. Idolaters wasn't promised salvation, and you don't even follow the most important commandment.

body:
> John 17:3 calls the father the only true God, polytheist. What does the word only mean? Adress it, polytheist.

It doesn't say what you think it does. If anything it likens them even further.

> you worship him as a God

So did the people in the New Testament. Of course you probably think they're all apostates. Actually is there anyone you don't think is apostate besides yourself?

> Worship God alone?

That most people can do, but that's not enough, and even that is only the first half of the commandment. If you're thinking is that you are perfectly good on your own, you are in serious trouble and will soon find that you were not even close. But pride blinds people of their faults, but all things will be revealed in time.

> And theos is used for elohim in the NT too, also when Hebrew noun is referring to human beings.

No, that means God. If it meant humans then I guess a human created the skies and land: 𐤁𐤓𐤀𐤔𐤉𐤕𐤟𐤁𐤓𐤀𐤟**𐤀𐤋𐤄𐤉𐤌**𐤟𐤀𐤕𐤟𐤄𐤔𐤌𐤉𐤌𐤟𐤅𐤀𐤕𐤟𐤄𐤀𐤓𐤑

you worship him as a God

So did the people in the New Testament. Of course you probably think they're all apostates. Actually is there anyone you don't think is apostate besides yourself?

Worship God alone?

That most people can do, but that's not enough, and even that is only the first half of the commandment. If you're thinking is that you are perfectly good on your own, you are in serious trouble and will soon find that you were not even close. But pride blinds people of their faults, but all things will be revealed in time.

And theos is used for elohim in the NT too, also when Hebrew noun is referring to human beings.

No, that means God. If it meant humans then I guess a human created the skies and land: 𐤁𐤓𐤀𐤔𐤉𐤕𐤟𐤁𐤓𐤀𐤟𐤀𐤋𐤄𐤉𐤌𐤟𐤀𐤕𐤟𐤄𐤔𐤌𐤉𐤌𐤟𐤅𐤀𐤕𐤟𐤄𐤀𐤓𐤑

>I never said such a thing. I said by your logic of "son" you should consider it so.

Son means male offspring, polytheist, also in Christian theology and doctrine. You don't know the basics of the religion you pretend to follow. So is Jesus God's son or God #2, polytheist? Do you still deny the sonship, yes or no?

>You just said it's not referring to God but then you say it can't be referring to anything else. Which is it?

Is asked you why there's no definite article, satanist. And theos is used for elohim in the NT too, also when Hebrew noun is referring to human beings. Start answer the questions now and stop deflecting. 

>What exactly do you want me to address about it?

You already know what, polytheist, but you're so satanic to the core of your being you can't even stop being dishonest. John 17:3 calls the father the only true God, polytheist. What does the word only mean? Adress it, polytheist. 

>Okay this is just a straight up lie. First of all, idolators worship other gods, which I do not.

False, satanist. Jesus is not God, you worship him as a God, and besides God (Whom you haven't even acknowledged yet), and a satanic, man-made 4th century triad-idol. 

>because no one besides Jesus in all of history has ever been able to do so.

Do what, satanist? Worship God alone? That's a filthy, disgusting lie from a compulsive liar. Look how you've proved every single point I've made since my first comment.

body: Envy. For some reason every single person I become friends with turns out to be this super high-achieving gifted person, usually in a lot of areas. I've always had the same aspirations but am not even good at one single thing, and it doesn't matter how many years of practice I put into it, everyone else still starts out 10x better than me with no effort. Basically I'm being selfish in general.

body:
I don't want to burden them, and besides it's still the same problem: no matter how much they teach me, I can still only do those exact things I was taught, exactly how I was taught. There's no fluidity or flexibility for me. I just don't have the instinct or flow to do everything naturally like they can, which is absolutely necessary to have even a little independence. I'm hopeless and I almost certainly always will be.

> Acquiring valuable connections is a useful skill.

It hasn't paid off either in my case. Every time someone around here starts another project (often a website), they're all invited but I'm still not. This happened to me a lot before ruqqus too. I think people can tell I'm a mistake even though they wouldn't dare say so. Even if it had helped me, so what? It doesn't change the core problem.
body_html:
I don't want to burden them, and besides it's still the same problem: no matter how much they teach me, I can still only do those exact things I was taught, exactly how I was taught. There's no fluidity or flexibility for me. I just don't have the instinct or flow to do everything naturally like they can, which is absolutely necessary to have even a little independence. I'm hopeless and I almost certainly always will be.

Acquiring valuable connections is a useful skill.

It hasn't paid off either in my case. Every time someone around here starts another project (often a website), they're all invited but I'm still not. This happened to me a lot before ruqqus too. I think people can tell I'm a mistake even though they wouldn't dare say so. Even if it had helped me, so what? It doesn't change the core problem.

guild.description:
This guild is about News far and wide!

Sister guild: +Commentary

#1. Things that are posted to News should be stated like a fact in the Headline.

In the sense, Headline: X happened or X said this. Not Personal opinions. 

They should be reporting.

#2. Personal slant or commentary should go in the comments, not the Headline. Commentary content (like discussion commentator shows) are not News. Commentary content will be redirected to +Commentary which is for that purpose. 

If it's News but is more an opinion piece please add [Opinion] in the title, or post in a topic specific guild. 

#3. No screenshots; provide a link, provide a source.

See Posting Etiquette pin for further explanation.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
they are part of a larger concept, I don't agree with people that want to find meaning in just 3 verses. (no ofense, I think it's great that you are reading the bible) great find, I'm going to read it to see the rest of the message.

Edit: I just read the full Ecclesiastes book for the first time, I liked it a lot, it was written by a wise dude that thought all the time about why everything is as it is. I recomment it to the ruqqusers that like conspiracies, because this guy was a conspiracy theorist of the past, looking for knowledge. after reading the whole book (its just like 10 pages long) I can tell it is about this: "life sucks, god is unjust, but while you think about it, remember to have as much fun as you can, and enjoy that fun because there will be years when you won't have any fun at all" very good book I liked it a lot.
parent.body_html:
they are part of a larger concept, I don't agree with people that want to find meaning in just 3 verses. (no ofense, I think it's great that you are reading the bible) great find, I'm going to read it to see the rest of the message.

Edit: I just read the full Ecclesiastes book for the first time, I liked it a lot, it was written by a wise dude that thought all the time about why everything is as it is. I recomment it to the ruqqusers that like conspiracies, because this guy was a conspiracy theorist of the past, looking for knowledge. after reading the whole book (its just like 10 pages long) I can tell it is about this: "life sucks, god is unjust, but while you think about it, remember to have as much fun as you can, and enjoy that fun because there will be years when you won't have any fun at all" very good book I liked it a lot.

post.body:
**1** Again I looked and saw all the oppression that was taking place under the sun:

I saw the tears of the oppressed—
    and they have no comforter;
power was on the side of their oppressors—
    and they have no comforter.

**2**  And I declared that the dead,
    who had already died,
are happier than the living,
    who are still alive.

**3**  But better than both
    is the one who has never been born,
who has not seen the evil
    that is done under the sun.
post.body_html:
1 Again I looked and saw all the oppression that was taking place under the sun:

I saw the tears of the oppressed— and they have no comforter; power was on the side of their oppressors— and they have no comforter.

2 And I declared that the dead, who had already died, are happier than the living, who are still alive.

3 But better than both is the one who has never been born, who has not seen the evil that is done under the sun.
post.title: How do you explain these verses? Ecclesiastes 4: 1-3

body:
It is. Unfortunately there's still a major problem that will make this site end up exactly like reddit down the road. That is, certain users are deemed "better" by the admins and given special treatment. This is especially prevalent in the discord server (where most of them are mods) where they are allowed to bypass every pleb restriction placed on all other users and break the rules that everyone else has to follow. However it also shows on ruqqus itself, where these users are much more likely or even exclusively chosen for certain important roles on the site (ex. alpha testing focus group and being guildmasters of admins' guilds). From what I've heard, they also get access to a bit of special information that is not public to the rest of the site. I've noticed admins also tend to respond to their posts more often and give their ideas much more weight, and they tend to award them badges and roles more often than other users. Apparently they also have a private channel on discord where the admins chat with them.

This is exactly the formula for a cabal of powermods, the same thing that caused the infamous "DefaultMods" on reddit. Lots of users have voiced their concerns over this but the admins act superior about it and use the "10 guildmaster limit" as an excuse to say the problem is solved, and refuse to listen to anyone. If this isn't changed, ruqqus will become just like reddit in the future.

Ruqqus is doing great in most other ways (except the admins could care a little more about freeze peach and transparency imo), including improving content. I'd hate to see it all go down the toilet because of this one fatal flaw.
body_html:
It is. Unfortunately there's still a major problem that will make this site end up exactly like reddit down the road. That is, certain users are deemed "better" by the admins and given special treatment. This is especially prevalent in the discord server (where most of them are mods) where they are allowed to bypass every pleb restriction placed on all other users and break the rules that everyone else has to follow. However it also shows on ruqqus itself, where these users are much more likely or even exclusively chosen for certain important roles on the site (ex. alpha testing focus group and being guildmasters of admins' guilds). From what I've heard, they also get access to a bit of special information that is not public to the rest of the site. I've noticed admins also tend to respond to their posts more often and give their ideas much more weight, and they tend to award them badges and roles more often than other users. Apparently they also have a private channel on discord where the admins chat with them.

This is exactly the formula for a cabal of powermods, the same thing that caused the infamous "DefaultMods" on reddit. Lots of users have voiced their concerns over this but the admins act superior about it and use the "10 guildmaster limit" as an excuse to say the problem is solved, and refuse to listen to anyone. If this isn't changed, ruqqus will become just like reddit in the future.

Ruqqus is doing great in most other ways (except the admins could care a little more about freeze peach and transparency imo), including improving content. I'd hate to see it all go down the toilet because of this one fatal flaw.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

post.body:
I'm looking through my feed and Ruqqus content is branching out in more directions, and (dare I say) is becoming more "diverse" in it's content.  

That's good to see.  We want to be a platform for everyone to use and have an enjoyable experience.  I think the first things new users should be told about are the "hide" feature and all other content filtering so they can get straight to what they enjoy and cut out what is less than desirable.  We should really emphasize to the user that they can make the experience their own.

Anyway keep up the good work and go team Ruqqus.
post.body_html:
I'm looking through my feed and Ruqqus content is branching out in more directions, and (dare I say) is becoming more "diverse" in it's content.

That's good to see. We want to be a platform for everyone to use and have an enjoyable experience. I think the first things new users should be told about are the "hide" feature and all other content filtering so they can get straight to what they enjoy and cut out what is less than desirable. We should really emphasize to the user that they can make the experience their own.

Anyway keep up the good work and go team Ruqqus.
post.title: Ruqqus content keeps growing and maturing.

body:
You can find images of most manuscripts online. Here is the Vaticanus for example: https://digi.vatlib.it/view/MSS_Vat.gr.1209

For the old testament the best is probably the dead sea scrolls and the aleppo/masoretic text. But don't forsake the others like the septuagint or peshitta either, there are some variants.
body_html:
You can find images of most manuscripts online. Here is the Vaticanus for example: https://digi.vatlib.it/view/MSS_Vat.gr.1209

For the old testament the best is probably the dead sea scrolls and the aleppo/masoretic text. But don't forsake the others like the septuagint or peshitta either, there are some variants.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

guild.name: Christianity

post.body:
Hi,

I have been increasingly drawn to Christianity and filled with a desire to embrace that attraction. Can anyone recommend a good edition of the Bible for a newcomer? I've seen many interpretive editions and Bible's for new Christians but I fear starting off learning through biased or one sided analyses.

Straight no frills bible? Which translation/edition? Any other advice? 

Thank you.
post.body_html:
Hi,

I have been increasingly drawn to Christianity and filled with a desire to embrace that attraction. Can anyone recommend a good edition of the Bible for a newcomer? I've seen many interpretive editions and Bible's for new Christians but I fear starting off learning through biased or one sided analyses.

Straight no frills bible? Which translation/edition? Any other advice?

Thank you.
post.title: Introduction to Christianity
